name: Lipinski, Appellant, v. Northeast Industrial District

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
parties: Lipinski, Appellant, v. Northeast Industrial District.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
While we sympathize with the views and contentions of appellant Julia Lipinski, the appeal is without legal merit and must be dismissed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Julia Lipinski, for appellant, in propria persona.
James F. Manley, with him Burton O. Duerring, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Lipinski, Appellant, v. Northeast Industrial District.
Argued March 23, 1971.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
Julia Lipinski, for appellant, in propria persona.
James F. Manley, with him Burton O. Duerring, for appellees.
April 22, 1971:
